sections.title: Research and Development (R&D) tax relief
sections.description: HMRC has taken your qualifying expenditure and multiplied it by 1.3 to calculate the amount of tax relief you can claim if your company is in profit.

fields.label: Claimable tax relief
fields.helpText: This figure should match the R&D enhanced expenditure on your Corporation Tax (CT600) return.

sections.title: Have you claimed an R&D tax credit for this period?
sections.description: If your company has incurred a loss, you can either carry it forward against trading profits in the future or give it up for a cash payment.

fields.errorMessage: Select yes or no if you have claimed a R&D tax credit

sections.title: What is your unrelieved trading loss for this claim period?

fields.label: Unrelieved trading loss
Definition of unrelieved trading loss
fields.infoText:
The unrelieved trading loss is: 

* the company's trading loss (where the company has spent more than it has made in an accounting period)

* less any other Corporation Tax profits of the claim period 

* less any loss relief claimed

declarationSection.title: Confirm details and send the form
declarationSection.shortName: Confirm details and send the form

fields.infoText:
If you give incomplete or inaccurate information, we may charge a financial penalty or even prosecute you.

You must enter the name of someone who is authorised to sign this declaration.

fields.label: Full name
fields.helpText: If an agent, enter name of agent
fields.errorMessage: Enter your full name

fields.label: Position in company
fields.errorMessage: Enter your position in company

fields.label: Email address
fields.helpText: We will send an email to this address to confirm the form has been submitted
fields.errorMessage: Enter your email address

fields.infoText: By submitting this form, you declare that the information that you have provided is true and complete.

We have sent you a confirmation email.

This is your last opportunity to print or save a pdf copy of your submitted form.

In most cases we aim to either pay the tax credit, or contact you about the claim within 28 days.

If we don’t hold accurate Bankers’ Automated Clearing Services (BACS) details, your payment will take longer to process.

If we think a claim may be incorrect, we aim to open an enquiry within 60 days. HMRC will contact you regarding the enquiry.
